title: What Were Rome’s Persian Borderlands Like?
description: Being a Roman isn't easy. Running an intercontinental empire across hundreds of languages, customs, and ethnic groups without the benefit of telegraphs or steam power requires constant vigilance or the whole enterprise will fall apart. Let's look at the Roman borderland's with Persia to see what life was like on the periphery of the empire.   TO HELP OUT THE SHOW Leave an honest review on iTunes.
